Nadal sutra odlučuje o učešću na završnom mastersu u Londonu
Očigledno da je povreda trbušnog zida veoma nezgodna

04 Nov 2019

Rafael Nadal bi možda bio i najbolji teniser svih vremena da nije sklon povredama. Tačnije, njegov način igranja, sa mnogo energije i siline u udarcima, koštaju ga neprestanih zdravstvenih problema.
Uglavnom mu tu "prednjače" kolena, ali ovaj put u Parizu je popustio trbušni zid. Zbog toga je Španac, koji se jutros vratio na čelo ATP liste, morao da preda bez borbe polufinale Denisu Šapovalovu. To je naravno savršeno iskoristio Novak Đoković i smanjio štetu, to jest zaostanak za Špancem na svetskoj lestvici na prihvatljivih i uhvatljivih 640 poena.
Međutim, sada se postavlja pitanje da li će Nadal uopšte učestvovati na završnom mastersu sezone koji počinje idućeg ponedeljka u Londonu. Povreda je očigledno veoma nezgodna, kakve uglavnom i jesu kada napuknu ili puknu abdominalni mišići jer učestvuju u bukvalno svakom pokretu tela. 
Uznemirujuće vesti stižu iz kampa Balearca koji je na pragu da odustane, a konačna odluka će biti doneta sutra, pred žrebanje za završni masters u Londonu koji će rešiti da li će Španac ostati na prvom mestu ATP liste koje je preuzeo danas od Đokovića, ili će se naš as vratiti na isto. Ukoliko odustane, u britanskoj prestoniciu će zaigrati njegov sunarodnik Roberto Bautosa Agut kao prva zamena.
"Jako mi je žao što se povredio, to nikome ne bih poželeo", izjavio je Beograđanin sinoć nakon pobede u Parizu, "Nadam se da će se Rafa oporaviti, turnir neće biti isti bez njega"

Nadal decides to participate in the final Masters in London tomorrow
Obviously, an abdominal wall injury is very tricky

04 Nov 2019

Rafael Nadal might be the best tennis player of all time if he wasn't prone to injury. More specifically, his playing style, with a lot of energy and power in the kicks, costs him ongoing health problems.
Mostly his knees "front", but this time in Paris he loosened his abdominal wall. That is why the Spaniard, who returned to the top of the ATP list this morning, had to hand over the semi-finals to Denis Shapovalov without a fight. Of course, this was perfectly used by Novak Djokovic and reduced the damage, that is, lagging behind the Spaniard on the world rankings by an acceptable and catching 640 points.
However, the question now is whether Nadal will even participate in the final masters of the season, which starts next Monday in London. The injury is obviously very inconvenient, as it usually is when they crack or break the abdominal muscles because they participate in virtually every movement of the body.
The disturbing news comes from Camp Balearca, which is about to quit, and a final decision will be made tomorrow, ahead of the final Masters draw in London, which will decide whether the Spaniard will remain in the top spot of the ATP roster he took today from Djokovic, or our ace back to the same. If he quits, his compatriot Roberto Bautosa Agut will play in the British capital as the first replacement.
"I am very sorry that he was injured, I would not wish that to anyone," the Belgrade man said last night after his victory in Paris, "I hope Rafa will recover, the tournament will not be the same without him."
